[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-26 15:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-11-26 15:36:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Great! It'd be cool to have a common topic por this effort, wdyt?"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-11-26 15:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/neutron-ovn-merge'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-26 15:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-26 20:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 10:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 11:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-27 13:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Will ovn become the new default for neutron and replace openvswitch?

There is also a neutron devstack plugin within the neutron repo, maybe this code can (mostly) be hosted there?'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 14:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 14:10:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Will ovn become the new default for neutron and replace
 > openvswitch?
 > 
 > There is also a neutron devstack plugin within the neutron repo,
 > maybe this code can (mostly) be hosted there?

Hi Jens,

Not straight away, but that's the idea in the medium/long run. We've just merged the spec [0][1] in Neutron which highlights this effort and it's next step (including this one about merging the code from networking-ovn into the Neutron repository).

And yes, there's a plugin in the Neutron tree. Sure you think it's better to have the neutron_plugins/ovn there ?

Let me know what would be best and I will try to accommodate the changes. I've started everything here cause I saw the logic from some other drivers/plugins/services were in this repo but I can move the OVN one out.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658414/"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-11-27 15:20:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Will ovn become the new default for neutron and replace
 > openvswitch?
 > 
 > There is also a neutron devstack plugin within the neutron repo,
 > maybe this code can (mostly) be hosted there?

Hi,

We are now starting process of moving ovn driver code to be in-tree neutron driver. So it will be the same like ovs and linuxbridge today. Because of that my idea was to move this code related to networking-ovn to devstack repo directly. As for today, if You want to deploy devstack with neutron with ovs or linuxbridge agent You don't need to do something like:

    enable_plugin neutron

so I don't think that this should be required if You will choose ovn as Q_AGENT (when this will be also in-tree).
What do You think Jens about this?"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-27 15:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I'm not sure really, adding >700 lines of code looks pretty difficult to review, so if you could review this whole thing within the neutron team, it would take some load off the only minimal devstack core team. 

I do also see your point about not needing the neutron devstack plugin, but maybe the could happen as a second step once the code is completely within neutron?

In case you decide that you still want to move into devstack directly: Is this copied 1:1 from the neutron-ovn repo? I'd also want to see some job(s) running and passing based on this before approving."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-27 15:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Another thing: With this you are effectively un-deprecating the neutron-legacy code, so you should actually make that explicit in a patch that comes before this one.

Not sure about deprecating the new neutron code at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 16:01:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I'm not sure really, adding >700 lines of code looks pretty
 > difficult to review, so if you could review this whole thing within
 > the neutron team, it would take some load off the only minimal
 > devstack core team.
 > 
 > I do also see your point about not needing the neutron devstack
 > plugin, but maybe the could happen as a second step once the code
 > is completely within neutron?
 > 
 > In case you decide that you still want to move into devstack
 > directly: Is this copied 1:1 from the neutron-ovn repo? I'd also
 > want to see some job(s) running and passing based on this before
 > approving.

It's not 1:1 because in networking ovn this functions are scattered around. Since we were going to move the code I decided to refactor it into one module with better comments and a clear interface (install_ovn, configure_ovn, init_ovn, start_ovn, stop_ovn and cleanup_ovn).

About having a job, yeah what I can do is create a job in Neutron tree with a depends-on on this patch. Would that be enough ?

Also, yeah, I feel the pain of having to review > 700 lines of code. Sorry for that. I can try to get some Neutron/networking-ovn folks to review it to help you out."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 16:03:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Another thing: With this you are effectively un-deprecating the
 > neutron-legacy code, so you should actually make that explicit in a
 > patch that comes before this one.
 > 
 > Not sure about deprecating the new neutron code at the same time.

That's a huge chunk of work to be honest with you, apparently everybody still using and sourcing neutron-legacy.

If possible, we would like to have the networking-ovn code moved to the neutron tree at the very beginning of the development cycle to avoid having to freeze new features and bug fixes later on. So would be OK if I open a bug (high prio) to refactor this DevStack modules after this effort ?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-11-28 10:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-28 13:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-28 13:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-12-13 09:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Workflow

I guess this is ready for review :D'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-12-13 09:21:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

Ops wrong patch'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-01-18 18:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I will abandon this for now as things are already merged in neutron'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-26 15:26:20.000000000', 'message': 'Move OVN DevStack logic into Neutron

The Neutron and networking-ovn projects are getting merged and the code
used to setup networkig-ovn will now co-exist with the Neutron DevStack
plugin.

This patch moves the logic to install and setup networking-ovn to the
Neutron DevStack plugin.

Note that neutron-legacy is used here since the "new" neutron module
does not work properly (I was told).

As a first step, this plugin will continue to use the
openstack/networking-ovn repository and, as we advance into the mergings
steps we will modify this plugin (just few lines) to use the code in
the Neutron repository itself.

TODO's where left in the code on top of all the bits that will change
once the networking-ovn code is merged into Neutron.

Below is a snippet of the what needs to be enabled in local.conf to get
OVN deployed:

[[local|localrc]]

Q_AGENT=ovn
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS=ovn,logger
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_TYPE_DRIVERS=local,flat,vlan,geneve
Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE="geneve"
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_EXT_DRIVERS=port_security,dns

Implements: blueprint neutron-ovn-merge
Change-Id: I6f4a1cde921b687d527a4098cd2db39b422f6257
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Move OVN DevStack logic into Neutron

The Neutron and networking-ovn projects are getting merged and the code
used to setup networkig-ovn will now co-exist with the Neutron DevStack
plugin.

This patch moves the logic to install and setup networking-ovn to the
Neutron DevStack plugin.

Note that neutron-legacy is used here since the "new" neutron module
does not work properly (I was told).

As a first step, this plugin will continue to use the
openstack/networking-ovn repository and, as we advance into the mergings
steps we will modify this plugin (just few lines) to use the code in
the Neutron repository itself.

TODO's where left in the code on top of all the bits that will change
once the networking-ovn code is merged into Neutron.

Below is a snippet of the what needs to be enabled in local.conf to get
OVN deployed:

[[local|localrc]]

Q_AGENT=ovn
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS=ovn,logger
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_TYPE_DRIVERS=local,flat,vlan,geneve
Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE="geneve"
Q_ML2_PLUGIN_EXT_DRIVERS=port_security,dns

Related-Blueprint: neutron-ovn-merge
Change-Id: I6f4a1cde921b687d527a4098cd2db39b422f6257
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Functional tests] Fix SIGHUP handling tests

Tests in neutron.functional.test_server module are testing how
PluginWorker, WSGIWorker and RPCWorker are handling SIGHUP signal.

Recently this was changed in Oslo.service with [1] and our tests
were failing because they were still expecting that after sending
SIGHUP to the process, stop() and than start() method will be called.

But as our services uses "mutate" as restart method, since [1] such
process don't executes stop() and start() after SIGHUP. It now executes
only reset() method.
This patch reflects that change in Neutron functional tests.

NOTE: this patch was merged in master combined with another bug
resolution [2] due to the existing problems in the CI. The other part
was already backported in [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641907/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680001/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680803/

Change-Id: I7a3f20a795c89ab1ab037d046a1101cd5c0287d6
Closes-Bug: #1842659
(cherry picked from commit bacc7abf83f18825a49af2c14cebbeb312615c1d)

commit_message:
Add support to configure pcsd bind address

Add support to configure pcsd bind address so that we can
make pcsd listen on specific address instead of all interfaces
on the node.

Related-Bug: #1856626
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/697942
Change-Id: I442b190b6fa429ee3a81fd2ea84ada6ed9bca7d2
(cherry picked from commit b5ee4bacacd3b63d98b7cf37d526c460f8113dcb)

curios to know if there's any benifit to using this on zero byte manifests like symlinks and dlos (even tho their error response includes needed metadata)"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-02 22:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

That's an interesting idea -- might could clean up some status codes getting logged in your object layer. It won't save us any round-trips, but seems like a better/more-correct status and it should make it easier to pick up on clients *unexpectedly* tripping 416s...

FWIW, on this patch at the moment, a (valid!) ranged GET to a link to a DLO gets me object logs like

 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio object-6020: 127.0.0.1 - - [02/Jan/2020:22:33:07 +0000] "GET /sdb2/42/AUTH_test/r/dlo-link" 416 97 "GET http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/r/dlo-link" "txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3" "proxy-server 20230" 0.0016 "-" 19981 1
 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio object-6030: 127.0.0.1 - - [02/Jan/2020:22:33:07 +0000] "GET /sdb3/1008/AUTH_test/r/dlo" 416 97 "GET http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/r/dlo" "txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3" "proxy-server 20230" 0.0016 "-" 19980 1
 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio object-6010: 127.0.0.1 - - [02/Jan/2020:22:33:07 +0000] "GET /sdb1/318/AUTH_test/r/data2" 206 3 "GET http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/r/data2?multipart-manifest=get" "txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3" "proxy-server 20230" 0.0010 "-" 19982 1

Proxy logs mostly look good, though:

 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio proxy-server: - - 02/Jan/2020/22/33/07 GET /v1/AUTH_test/r/dlo HTTP/1.0 499 - curl/7.66.0 - - 97 - txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3 - 0.0139 SYM - 1578004387.733146906 1578004387.747078419 1
 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio proxy-server: - - 02/Jan/2020/22/33/07 GET /v1/AUTH_test/r%3Fprefix%3Ddata%26format%3Djson%26states%3Dlisting HTTP/1.0 200 - curl/7.66.0%20DLO%20MultipartGET - - 830 - txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3 - 0.0147 DLO - 1578004387.749307632 1578004387.764034033 1
 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio proxy-server: - - 02/Jan/2020/22/33/07 GET /v1/AUTH_test/r/data2%3Fmultipart-manifest%3Dget HTTP/1.0 206 - curl/7.66.0%20%20DLO%20MultipartGET - - 3 - txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3 - 0.0148 DLO - 1578004387.767214775 1578004387.782064438 1
 Jan  2 22:33:07 saio proxy-server: 192.168.8.1 192.168.8.1 02/Jan/2020/22/33/07 GET /v1/AUTH_test/r/dlo-link HTTP/1.0 206 - curl/7.66.0 - - 3 - txcaf63a139d204b7981c40-005e0e6fa3 - 0.0635 - - 1578004387.720348835 1578004387.783852577 1

The 499's a little funny, but I think it's mostly unavoidable -- the DLO might actually have data attached to it! Maybe we could do some sort of length check before closing out the app_iter -- like, if we're under an object_chunk_size, just consume it. *shrug*

I'll give it a spin adding X-Object-Manifest and X-Object-Sysmeta-Symlink-Target to X-Backend-Ignore-Range-If-Metadata-Present.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-03 00:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-16 03:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-16 04:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Have slo tell the object-server that it wants whole manifests

Otherwise, we waste a request on some 416/206 response that won't be
helpful.

To do this, add a new X-Backend-Ignore-Range-If-Metadata-Present header
whose value is a comma-separated list of header names. Middlewares may
include this header to tell object-servers to send the whole object
(rather than a 206 or 416) if *any* of the metadata are present.

Have dlo and symlink use it, too; it won't save us any round-trips, but
it should clean up some object-server logging.

Change-Id: I4ff2a178d0456e7e37d561109ef57dd0d92cbd4e

[{'created': '2020-01-14 17:20:35.000000000', 'message': "Set fixed version for networking-calico

Calico plugin installation fails, as they tend to tag the same SHA
several times, which breaks PBR. This results in non-working deployments
To avoid it we set fixed calico version and will be maintaining it's
update manualy from time to time. Their codebase don't change frequently

Change-Id: I4b855429b95772b71316760b8873d8feca9c2780
"}]
commit_message:
Set fixed version for networking-calico

Calico plugin installation fails, as they tend to tag the same SHA
several times, which breaks PBR. This results in non-working deployments
To avoid it we set fixed calico version and will be maintaining it's
update manualy from time to time. Their codebase don't change frequently

Change-Id: I4b855429b95772b71316760b8873d8feca9c2780

[{'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 14:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 14:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 14:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 14:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 15:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

current method of doing spoof checking may pose an issue if admin mac is zero.

need to check that.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-15 15:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

personally i think a better approch is to lookup the netev the is mapped too the pci device in sysfs directly without ever using the mac.

just use the pci address 
e.g. for a vf with address 0000:01:11.3
/sys/bus/pci/devices/0000\:01\:11.3/net/
will list the netdev associated with that VF

if it used via vnic-type direct the net folder will not exist
if vnic-type=macvtap it will be
the vf netdev name is found in net and the macvtap port will appear as a subfuldder prefixed with upper_

e.g.
/sys/bus/pci/devices/0000\:01\:11.3/net/enp1s17f3/upper_macvtap0

if its not in use the net directory will exist if the vf is bound to the kernl dirver
/sys/bus/pci/devices/0000\:01\:11.3/net/enp1s17f3/

the only way the sriov nic agent should learn about the mac is via the neutron port info but it should not use that or the netdev names to coralte the relation with pf or vfs.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 16:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Additional discussion can be found:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675776/'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-08-15 16:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/676713/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 50m 29s'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 16:44:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Relying solely on sysfs is not a valid solution for old kernels per commit[1]

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/d7604169988726d121cdc9727accfeb6e29f4aed'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-15 16:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

do we have any distro that support stien on a kernel < 3.13.

OSP15 which si the proctised version of stien will be supported on rhel8 only which is based on 4.18. maybe centos but i dont know if it had the behavior in that bug.

i am not sure that still holds today.

ip tools could still be used but we should not rely on the mac to do the correlation.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2019-08-15 18:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> do we have any distro that support stien on a kernel < 3.13.
 > 
 > OSP15 which si the proctised version of stien will be supported on
 > rhel8 only which is based on 4.18. maybe centos but i dont know if
 > it had the behavior in that bug.
 > 
 > i am not sure that still holds today.
 > 
 > ip tools could still be used but we should not rely on the mac to
 > do the correlation.

At the time when I fix it the bug was centos 7.1 which is pretty old. So I think it will be fine to do it with the upper_macvtap symbolic link'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-18 09:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So, since:
1. old kernel
2. no official coupling between Nova, Neutron and kernel/OS (i.e openstack supports these OSes with these Kernels)
3. productized openstack will use newer kernel (ill try and check other productized openstack e.g canonical)

we can safely transition towards using sysfs upper dev symbolic link instead of whats being done today (output parsing of ip link show...)

I will propose a commit to use sysfs (possibly revert the original commit) and propose this on top of it.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-18 17:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-08-18 19:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

(5 comments)

 > commit[1]
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/d7604169988726d121cdc9727accfeb6e29f4aed

Sorry Adrian, but the parent commit is doing exactly the opposite you are stating here [1]: you are removing the old kernel limitation.

BTW, and this is just a comment for [1], according to [2], 3.10 is still supported in CentOS

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677095/3
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/openstack-ansible/latest/overview-requirements.html'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-09-01 15:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sorry Adrian, but the parent commit is doing exactly the opposite you are stating here [1]: you are removing the old kernel limitation.

BTW, and this is just a comment for [1], according to [2], 3.10 is still supported in CentOS


Yes, but after a discussion here, since the kernel is old, i assumed it was safe to remove the ~4 year old code (in the parrent commit)

This is set as workflow -1, i will probably abandon this commit as the better solution is to get rid of mac address dependency entirely as depicted in [X].

So i think only the parent commit should be reviewed for the time being.

It is not clear to me what is the OS support list for Neutron (Or openstack projects in general)

does openstack-ansible is the "source of truth" around supported OSes ? maybe we need to bump the version there (centOS 7 is pretty old)?

[X] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1841067'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-09-02 07:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Abandoning this commit as the proper solution is to remove sriov agent mac address dependency entirely as depicted in [1].

until this is achieved, [2] proposes to revert a cleanup in nova which prevented macvtap ports from being recognized by the agent.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1841067
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675776/'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-09-02 07:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-11-17 07:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

commit_message:
Use effective MAC address for macvtap assigned VFs

This commit modifies the way sriov agent retrieves mac
addresses for macvtap assigned VFs to use the effective
mac taken from the macvtap net device instead of the
administrative mac set on the PF.

This commit rids sriov agent from depending on hypervisor/nova
to set both administrative and effective mac for macvtap ports.

Related-Bug: #1841067

Change-Id: Id499bcc49d27f13f7f03481922a3383b4a255da1

commit_message:
Ansible lint: disable some checks

204 for very long url which is hard to break safely
306 for "echo | docker" as echo should not fall

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 09:18:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes

Currently an HA deployment making use of PacemakerRemote for any HA role
will fail with the following:
2020-01-16 08:40:22.707 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Start container mysql_restart_bundle as mysql_restart_bundle.
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Path seperator found in volume (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf), but did not exist on the file system
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] /etc/corosync/corosync.conf is not a valid volume source
...
2020-01-16 08:40:53.026 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] The following containers failed validations and were not started: mysql_restart_bundle

The reason for this is that via I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45 (HA: fix
<service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow), we consolidated
all the restart bundles into a single place inside
containers-common.yaml but we forgot to conditionalize the inclusion of
the /etc/corosync/corosync.conf bind mount. In fact this bind mount is
not needed since we started using RHEL/CentOS 8 (i.e. since the podman
introduction). See I399098bf734aa3b2862e1713d4b1f429d180afbc (Fix pcmk
remote podman bundle restarts) for more context

Change-Id: I7766a75414bf8db75ccd233677e9ffe13ff28e23
Closes-Bug: #1859945

commit_message:
Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes

Currently an HA deployment making use of PacemakerRemote for any HA role
will fail with the following:
2020-01-16 08:40:22.707 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Start container mysql_restart_bundle as mysql_restart_bundle.
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Path seperator found in volume (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf), but did not exist on the file system
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] /etc/corosync/corosync.conf is not a valid volume source
...
2020-01-16 08:40:53.026 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] The following containers failed validations and were not started: mysql_restart_bundle

The reason for this is that via I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45 (HA: fix
<service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow), we consolidated
all the restart bundles into a single place inside
containers-common.yaml but we forgot to conditionalize the inclusion of
the /etc/corosync/corosync.conf bind mount. In fact this bind mount is
not needed since we started using RHEL/CentOS 8 (i.e. since the podman
introduction). See I399098bf734aa3b2862e1713d4b1f429d180afbc (Fix pcmk
remote podman bundle restarts) for more context

Tested in a composable HA deployment where the Messaging and the
Database roles were using PacemakerRemote and correctly deployed the
environment (which would previously fail):
[root@messaging-0 ~]# crm_mon -1 |grep -e database -e messaging
RemoteOnline: [ database-0 database-1 database-2 messaging-0 messaging-1 messaging-2 ]
 database-0     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 database-1     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 database-2     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 messaging-0    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 messaging-1    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 messaging-2    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 galera-bundle-0      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-0
 galera-bundle-1      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-1
 galera-bundle-2      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-2
 rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-0
 rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-1
 rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-2

Change-Id: I7766a75414bf8db75ccd233677e9ffe13ff28e23
Closes-Bug: #1859945

commit_message:
Initialize nova_notifier for only port data changes

If notify_nova_on_port_status_changes is False, but
notify_nova_on_port_data_changes is True, the nova_notifier
object in the plugin will not be initialized correctly.
This was never noticed because these two options are
typically configured identically.

Change-Id: I3b0ca77b677fe335161b9a649b4ac397e64eacaa
Related-bug: #1843269

When the evacuate is run without specifying a target host, horizon

commit_message:
Allow to evacuate without specifying a target host

When the evacuate is run without specifying a target host, horizon
sets an empty string for target host. But the evacuate api doesn't
allow an empty string. As a result, nova returns "HTTP 400 Bad
request".

So this patch sets None as the target host when it isn't specified.

Change-Id: Ia865a6c02e206fa49efc3095e8d3488f5638d0e3
Closes-Bug: 1793694

commit_message:
Add upgrade check for removed VZStorage driver

The VZStorage driver has been removed. This adds an upgrade check to
warn if it is still configured.

Change-Id: I2ebff8a8657cacaf6402136cd1168c1091f006ec
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Hi Colleen, I created application credential with access_rules [1]. Then I tried to show access rules with the access rules id generated i.e u'id': u'ad1fa3a2b7ae4b25ae36447d39d9aed2'. The response I got is 
[2][1]. 

When trying to delete access_rules the result is [2][3]. The error message looks fine but it wasn't able to find the access_rule.

When trying to list access_rules the result is [2][3]. Which I think an empty list should be there if no access_rules are there.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/785539/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/785540/"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-10-24 17:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Did you install python-keystoneclient>=3.22.0 ?'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-10-24 17:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-10-30 10:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I missed installing python-keystoneclient=3.22.0. With this all access rule list show are working fine. But I am not able to delete access rule [1]. While deleting the reason it says that it is in use, I just created it not using it.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/785653/'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-10-30 12:54:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

 > 
 > [1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/785653/

You can't delete an access rule while its application credential still exists: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html?expanded=delete-access-rule-detail#delete-access-rule"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-10-30 17:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Question for the osc team - with this change it's possible to do create an app cred with a pre-existing rule like this:

openstack application credential create foobar --access-rules '[{"id":"6b7886050893492f9a3f6e081a2c34c6"}]'

which just follows the JSON API, but would it be better to enable something like

openstack application credential create foobar --access-rule 6b7886050893492f9a3f6e081a2c34c6 --access-rule 1af4fab20cf347d089a57d5651b8b1a9

?'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-11-21 10:24:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

 > You can't delete an access rule while its application credential
 > still exists: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html?expanded=delete-access-rule-detail#delete-access-rule

Got it. Thanks for closing my comments. Looks good to me."}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-11-21 10:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

[{'created': '2019-08-22 00:39:52.000000000', 'message': "Add support for app cred access rules

This commit introduces the --access-rules option for 'application
credential create' as well as new 'access rule' commands for listing,
showing, and deleting access rules.

commit_message:
Add support for app cred access rules

This commit introduces the --access-rules option for 'application
credential create' as well as new 'access rule' commands for listing,
showing, and deleting access rules.

bp whitelist-extension-for-app-creds

Change-Id: I04834b2874ec2a70da456a380b5bef03a392effa

[{'created': '2020-01-15 14:28:30.000000000', 'message': 'Respect driver_info.force_persistent_boot_device

This option has been created to work around flacky hardware that
does not work correctly with temporary boot. However, ironic-inspector
unconditionally uses persistent=False. This change fixes it.

Story: #2007093
Task: #38126
Change-Id: Ie21e5beeec6188e3b979c28167e575e1c37087ee

commit_message:
Respect driver_info.force_persistent_boot_device

This option has been created to work around flacky hardware that
does not work correctly with temporary boot. However, ironic-inspector
unconditionally uses persistent=False. This change fixes it.

Story: #2007093
Task: #38126
Change-Id: Ie21e5beeec6188e3b979c28167e575e1c37087ee

Add upgrade check for removed Sheepdog driver

The Sheepdog driver has been removed. This adds an upgrade check to warn
if it is still configured.

Add upgrade check for removed Nimble driver

The Nimble driver has been removed. This adds an upgrade check to warn
if it is still configured.

Change-Id: Id025033a9c1885ba3e3d7c9158d8ce1c6f376d1a

do we care about python3.4?  I thought we only cared about 3.{5,6,7} in master'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-16 07:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> do we care about python3.4?  I thought we only cared about 3.{5,6,7} in master

I am okay with either, but IIUC generate-constraints job still generates entries for python3.4. There is no intention on python 3.4 in this change. If you would like me to drop it, I will drop python 3.4 entry from my patch.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-16 07:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Note that horizon no longer uses Pint. The only consumer of Pint looks like ironic-python-agent.

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=import%20pint&i=nope&files=&repos='}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-01-16 07:11:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

pint is still in horizon's requirements.txt

| openstack/horizon                                | requirements.txt                                         |   31 | Pint>=0.5 # BSD               |
| openstack/ironic-python-agent                    | requirements.txt                                         |   13 | Pint>=0.5 # BSD               |

it would be nice to remove things instead :D"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-16 08:00:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> pint is still in horizon's requirements.txt

Horizon does not use Pint but we forgot to drop it from requirements.txt.
The cleanup is proposed https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702539/"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-01-16 16:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

thanks, that's what I thought had happened"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-01-17 15:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Cap Pint version for python 3.5 or older

Python <3.6 support was dropped in Pint 0.10 [1].
Pint in upper-constraints.txt was updated to 0.10 recently and it causes
a failure in the translation jobs which run with python 3.5 [2].
This commit caps Pint version to 0.9 for python 3.4 and 3.5.

[1] https://github.com/hgrecco/pint/issues/906
[2] http://zuul.openstack.org/build/2ba794496679447a97537e82857eba0e

Change-Id: I605115b0c2f4ea7dcf147238e9f6234e92c7d7ca

requirements.

commit_message:
Ovn upgrade - test if db already exist

Test if db already exist before doing the ovstool create.
If not it will failed during upgrade

Closes-Bug: #1853012
Change-Id: I6d97a9dcf5609003663920e8762e07ceea2e7933

commit_message:
[fs052] use plain smoke tag for tempest tests in seperate var

In fs052 periodic, for running smoke tests, we are using a ugly
smoke regex which is not properly parsed by stestr regex processor,
let' use plain smoke tag to trigger the smoke tests from a seperate var
and also fix the conditional to run smoke test only in periodic.

Closes-Bug: #1860016

Change-Id: Iac061507cbb2a8756f8a0e124eb7d43afa7b318f
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-17 15:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove default ansible option in test runs

This change removes the default ansible option in test runs. This is being
removed because if any args are presnet the test job will only run one
scenario, which is "default", unless otherwise defined.

Change-Id: I0fac174ef4ac801f6bb96e06eed0a29e3a064d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default ansible option in test runs

This change removes the default ansible option in test runs. This is being
removed because if any args are presnet the test job will only run one
scenario, which is "default", unless otherwise defined.

Change-Id: I0fac174ef4ac801f6bb96e06eed0a29e3a064d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Check network conflict

The user's network to create instance should not conflict with the
management network.

This patch also fixes the bug in trove-guestagent:
AttributeError: 'TroveContext' object has no attribute 'notification'
which has been merged in master branch in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697225/

Change-Id: I922a1c5469309704cc6dd60a1ef57e43a98a3c00
(cherry picked from commit 263339b4db0fb8e1d10c9933b71a0d5b7140cc68)

commit_message:
Fix testsuite: pep8 and requirements-integration

fix pep8:
Cap hacking, a newer hacking version includes newer pep8 and includes
more warnings that break build. There's no reason to update hacking in a
stable branch.

fix requirements-integration:
Cap gunicorn, version 20 is only supporting Python 3.5 and newer (see
also I81658ed225d6da3b98fc63d8454562a2f27a2995 for train).

Failures can be seen in
https://review.opendev.org/702915 and https://review.opendev.org/702462.

Change-Id: I7420dca0b3a1bd11db634629ef92e275368f50bc

commit_message:
Increase service restart sleep from 5 to 15s

Current sleep time of 5 seconds after restarting a service is not always
sufficient enough for the service to become fully active in certain
environments. Increasing the sleep time from 5 seconds to 15. This
should be considered an interim fix, long term a more elegant solution
should be utilized for handling graceful service restarts.

Change-Id: I0b1786dd6cfa74d7ed315b0b3a92968a10a2c3e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-10 12:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revision number race condition with attaching router interfaces

There's a special case in the update_port_precommit() method to handle
the case where an existing port is being added to a router. The method
will try to create an entry in the ovn_revision_numbers table but, if
that entry is already present a DBDuplicateEntry exception will be
raised and the whole update method will fail.

The update_port_precommit() is the only method at present that have this
special handler, for all other resources creating a new record in the
ovn_revision_numbers table happens at the create_*_precommit() methods
(this include create_port_precommit() as well).

This patch is fixing the problem by adding a new parameter to the
reate_initial_revision() method called "may_exist". When set to True the
code will not raise an DBDuplicateEntry if the record already exists. By
default this method is False.

Closes-Bug: #1800875
Change-Id: Iddd89725e617b22c35e30ae7f20a7f87de296cdb
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b5642d93a6c0ce0141fb5f61a3d853b026b7b67d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix revision number race condition with attaching router interfaces

There's a special case in the update_port_precommit() method to handle
the case where an existing port is being added to a router. The method
will try to create an entry in the ovn_revision_numbers table but, if
that entry is already present a DBDuplicateEntry exception will be
raised and the whole update method will fail.

The update_port_precommit() is the only method at present that have this
special handler, for all other resources creating a new record in the
ovn_revision_numbers table happens at the create_*_precommit() methods
(this include create_port_precommit() as well).

This patch is fixing the problem by adding a new parameter to the
reate_initial_revision() method called "may_exist". When set to True the
code will not raise an DBDuplicateEntry if the record already exists. By
default this method is False.

Closes-Bug: #1800875
Change-Id: Iddd89725e617b22c35e30ae7f20a7f87de296cdb
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b5642d93a6c0ce0141fb5f61a3d853b026b7b67d)

commit_message:
Revert "bulk: Use make_subrequest to make subrequests"

This reverts commit 6f00d42f56d38e6267b819fdf06b7264feb50683.

However, we *should* clear the swift.proxy_access_log_made flag for
subrequests.

Also, since we ported bulk to py3 *after* the above commit, adda few
more unicode test cases and guards.

Closes-Bug: 1857546
Related-Bug: 1486193
Change-Id: I8cf5d51a5384496fc85e43deb76603a8b620ba6e

commit_message:
Remove ssh configurations

Newer versions (2.x) of Ranger is removing git repo support When
Older versions (1.x) still using it, this patch is to attempt to flag to
not use repo in case not supported repo and do cleanup

Change-Id: I36c36faa0be1f9e9ea4e5479e219dc14c205d853

nova-net: Remove unused exceptions

Not all of these are nova-network related, but all are unused

Change-Id: I6fd027fb51823b8a8a24ed7b864a2191c4e8e8c0

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove unnecessary 'neutronv2' prefixes

There's only one networking solution now. No need to keep these around.

Change-Id: Ibd97a0be22e0a894f3b1fdea052ee6359753457c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Pin neutron-lib in stable/rocky to <2.0.0

neutron-tempest-plugin is pulling in the latest version
otherwise, which will fail since it doesn't support
python2.

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: I68ab10b4ac0e09b7d850e7c8f855a7e95c22d141

I don't disagree. However, I'm not familiar with how to do this for these projects and I'm not making things worse.

Horizon breaks with Rocky without this. I would be willing to try to add a test case, but gating it on this seems like it will prevent it from seeing the light of day for a longer period of time. :-)"}, {'account_id': 25089, 'date': '2020-01-17 18:13:14.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

It looks like Train has removed documentation for this capability, and it looks like this fix isn't needed in Train for the original problem I was having ('os_hash_algo', 'os_hash_value').

I still think this feature was allowed to break, and then the fix was not allowed to be submitted. But, I no longer need this feature, so I will abandon this review and let somebody else take it up if they need this feature returned."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 03:10:52.000000000', 'message': 'Restore IMAGE_RESERVED_CUSTOM_PROPERTIES behaviour

As a result of commit 3c2ce866 ("Angularize metadata update modals"),
the capability to define image custom properties that should not be
displayed in the Image Custom Properties table was lost. The setting
remained in the sample file and documentation, but it no longer had
any effect.

This change restores the original behaviour. Image properties are
filtered before they are returned to the client.

Change-Id: I6672ab5970178bc5526012f557f0f59a712f0a07
Partial-Bug: 1830301
'}]
commit_message:
Restore IMAGE_RESERVED_CUSTOM_PROPERTIES behaviour

As a result of commit 3c2ce866 ("Angularize metadata update modals"),
the capability to define image custom properties that should not be
displayed in the Image Custom Properties table was lost. The setting
remained in the sample file and documentation, but it no longer had
any effect.

This change restores the original behaviour. Image properties are
filtered before they are returned to the client.

Change-Id: I6672ab5970178bc5526012f557f0f59a712f0a07
Partial-Bug: 1830301

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17887, 'name': 'Doug Schveninger', 'email': 'ds6901@att.com', 'username': 'Doug.Schveninger'}, {'_account_id': 20190, 'name': 'zhufl', 'email': 'zhu.fanglei@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'zhufl'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23186, 'name': 'Felipe Monteiro', 'email': 'felipe.carneiro.monteiro@gmail.com', 'username': 'felipe.monteiro'}, {'_account_id': 27078, 'name': 'Manik Bindlish', 'email': 'manikbindlish19@gmail.com', 'username': 'manik'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-09-12 15:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 15:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Definitely agree this needs to be reverted. Not all currently supported versions of cinder were strict about schema validation, so tempest should not be enforcing that. Further, the ones that do support it are already doing schema validation, so I see no value in tempest doing the same.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-09-12 17:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sean,

Current Tempest validation is for response body which is returned from Cinder API, not request body.
I don't think Cinder should support JSONSchema for its response which is returned by Cinder itself.
According to the bug report, the property 'groups' is missed in the API response.
The property has been added after Ocata?
If so, we just need to remove 'groups' from the following list of required properties:

                 'required': ['id', 'volumes', 'snapshots', 'backups',
                             'per_volume_gigabytes', 'gigabytes',
                             'backup_gigabytes', 'groups'],"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-09-12 18:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If the above guessing is right, we could merge https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681863/ instead for stable/ocata.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-12 23:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yeah, Tempest master does not support Ocata branch as this is in EM state. as per Tempest stable branch policy, if EM branch fails due to master changes then that branch needs to use Tempest working tag instead of Tempest master.[1]

We need to install Tempest v20.0.0 in Ocata. 

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-12 23:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Sean,
 > 
 > Current Tempest validation is for response body which is returned
 > from Cinder API, not request body.
 > I don't think Cinder should support JSONSchema for its response
 > which is returned by Cinder itself.
 > According to the bug report, the property 'groups' is missed in the
 > API response.
 > The property has been added after Ocata?
 > If so, we just need to remove 'groups' from the following list of
 > required properties:
 > 
 > 'required': ['id', 'volumes', 'snapshots', 'backups',
 > 'per_volume_gigabytes', 'gigabytes',
 > 'backup_gigabytes', 'groups'],

But is new field added in API response without new microversion ? if so then it seems API interoperbility issue. All fields added/removed/updated in API response should be with new microversion. 
This seems Cinder bug for me which is caught by Tempest schema validation."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2020-01-17 17:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:

This breaks tempest runs for cinder stable/ocata.
Closes-Bug: #1843762

Change-Id: Ibd60a7b2dfde4e70dcbcb03e640b7a9eb6fbae68

commit_message:
Update Zuul job name for tempest tests

We should run the job testing the new merged API.

The change also removes Pyhon 2 tempest tests which are not supported
anymore.

Additionally, temporarily set the job as non-voting to allow merging
cross-dependant changes in API and tempest test related to ELK upgrade.

Change-Id: I4e679ca48a971bf39231688b57d03fc0ccd48183
Story: 2003881
Task: 37984

hard requirement. This patch fixes symlink of python ceph libraries.

commit_message:
Migrate openstack modules as a collection

Migrate accordin to Ansible guidelines [1[]] and tool
migrate.py [2]
Also fixed ALL ansible-test sanity issues

Add pep8 and linter job with runs ansible-test sanity test.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/openstack-ansible-modules
[2] https://github.com/ansible-community/collection_migration

Change-Id: Ib2b1c8f23aacfca95304132bfe5c4cdedbea0520

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 14:08:14.000000000', 'message': 'Force OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION to a lower one on workload test.

After the upgrade prepare and right before the upgrade run
command a workload test is executed, which creates an instance
and performs a pingtest during the whole upgrade procedure.
The generated rc file for the OC has the OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
pointing to 2.latest which provokes a conflict in this situation
as we have a OSP16 Undercloud and a OSP15 overcloud, failing with
the error: Version 2.79 is not supported by the API. Minimum is
Minimum is 2.1 and maximum is 2.72.

This patch forces the maximum version on the script launch to be
2.72 at max.

Change-Id: I8c949de2083fa6b251ad7c8c6a2e57d6b9c3465e
(cherry picked from commit b717d4f08933c341d375e3ad43ec10768d0a7d04)
'}]
commit_message:
Force OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION to a lower one on workload test.

After the upgrade prepare and right before the upgrade run
command a workload test is executed, which creates an instance
and performs a pingtest during the whole upgrade procedure.
The generated rc file for the OC has the OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
pointing to 2.latest which provokes a conflict in this situation
as we have a OSP16 Undercloud and a OSP15 overcloud, failing with
the error: Version 2.79 is not supported by the API. Minimum is
Minimum is 2.1 and maximum is 2.72.

This patch forces the maximum version on the script launch to be
2.72 at max.

Change-Id: I8c949de2083fa6b251ad7c8c6a2e57d6b9c3465e
(cherry picked from commit b717d4f08933c341d375e3ad43ec10768d0a7d04)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-02 19:40:52.000000000', 'message': 'Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: I3cd4ad5c3fe590cb1522b2be1b2059d7c70b45cc
'}]
commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: I3cd4ad5c3fe590cb1522b2be1b2059d7c70b45cc

commit_message:
Drop unittest2 usage

unittest2 was needed for Python versions <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite some time now. See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest package.

Change-Id: I40882f14ff2ac121764b432fc745b21ae751e321
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Drop use of unittest2

unittest2 was needed for Python version <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite some time now. See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This replaces unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest package.

Change-Id: Idd5df4c8068810bbbd2bd5058ca38df9f5416a62
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Skip nic numa_node discovery if it's not assigned to a numa_node

In some rare case, such as a VM with virtual numa node, nics might
not be in a numa node and this breaks numa-topology discovery.

Change-Id: I52f52119a5f3175b1723fde291eb26d4f86c8223
Story: 2007105
Task: 38151

commit_message:
Remove deprecated glance-registry from nrpe checks

This patch removes the deprecated glance-registry service from nrpe
checks after an openstack upgrade to an openstack version greater than
Rocky

Closes-Bug: #1849896
Depends-On: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/409

Change-Id: I274441966f15f66341adf30c07c625cc76b2ecb6
Signed-off-by: Alexandros Soumplis <soumplis@admin.grnet.gr>
(cherry picked from commit b5e6a3e03a1a8756f545a47e413dbe1a27f92407)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28014, 'date': '2019-12-18 19:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-31 11:55:37.000000000', 'message': "Add binary_prefix=true argument to mysql uri

This patch adds the argument binary_prefix=true to MySQL uri if
OpenStack version is equal or greater than Rocky due to Python
upper-constraints [1]. This argument is required because of PyMySQL's
change from version 0.8 and on [2], in order to fix Gnocchi API
warnings like this [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/rocky/upper-constraints.txt#L377
[2] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L61-L64
[3] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/847

Change-Id: Ie8b10209daa4de74427e175ef21ddf306a17a0ae
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
(cherry picked from commit bf7ac78d07a313651e486196309140517d9ad861)
"}, {'created': '2019-12-20 12:42:12.000000000', 'message': "Add binary_prefix=true argument to mysql uri

This patch adds the argument binary_prefix=true to MySQL uri if
OpenStack version is equal or greater than Rocky due to Python
upper-constraints [1]. This argument is required because of PyMySQL's
change from version 0.8 and on [2], in order to fix Gnocchi API
warnings like this [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/rocky/upper-constraints.txt#L377
[2] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L61-L64
[3] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/847

Changing condition release from rocky to queens for mysql uri

As Queens also has PyMySQL 0.8.0 dependency so it has the same issue[1][2][3][4],
changing condition release from rocky to queens to fix warning flood.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/charm-gnocchi/commit/bf7ac78d07a313651e486196309140517d9ad861
[2] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/rocky/upper-constraints.txt#L377
[3] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/queens/upper-constraints.txt#L374
[4] gnocchixyz/gnocchi#847

Change-Id: Ie8b10209daa4de74427e175ef21ddf306a17a0ae
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
(cherry picked from commit bf7ac78d07a313651e486196309140517d9ad861)
(cherry picked from commit 408bf97a36bd9538d07e92398a8278b567b78fc3)
"}, {'created': '2020-01-14 03:15:53.000000000', 'message': "Add binary_prefix=true argument to mysql uri

This patch adds the argument binary_prefix=true to MySQL uri if
OpenStack version is equal or greater than Rocky due to Python
upper-constraints [1]. This argument is required because of PyMySQL's
change from version 0.8 and on [2], in order to fix Gnocchi API
warnings like this [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/rocky/upper-constraints.txt#L377
[2] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L61-L64
[3] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/847

Change-Id: Ie8b10209daa4de74427e175ef21ddf306a17a0ae

commit_message:
Add binary_prefix=true argument to mysql uri

This patch adds the argument binary_prefix=true to MySQL uri if
OpenStack version is equal or greater than Rocky due to Python
upper-constraints [1]. This argument is required because of PyMySQL's
change from version 0.8 and on [2], in order to fix Gnocchi API
warnings like this [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/rocky/upper-constraints.txt#L377
[2] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L61-L64
[3] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/847

Change-Id: Ie8b10209daa4de74427e175ef21ddf306a17a0ae
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
(cherry picked from commit bf7ac78d07a313651e486196309140517d9ad861)

Change-Id: I72ee5ee865d346124e5591939956bb0a610f59e0
'}, {'created': '2020-01-17 10:27:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove trusty testing

OpenDev is removing trusty nodes, stop testing on it with removing
a job that used trusty.

commit_message:
Remove trusty testing

OpenDev is removing trusty nodes, stop testing on it with removing
a job that used trusty.

to fix test failures:
* Use python2 as basepython so that we do not use python3

Change-Id: I72ee5ee865d346124e5591939956bb0a610f59e0

commit_message:
Add --stack option in system upgrade commands.

Now that most of our CI jobs have a customized stack name,
we need to pass it in the system upgrade steps. Otherwise
the upgrade will fail as it can't locate the stack.

Change-Id: I71b566bd38ab190613f4d934301243065133d562
(cherry picked from commit 596254e5d8ff7e170803169d5796f392354b9faa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-15 09:51:26.000000000', 'message': 'Run upgrade for previous hosts only in Controller role.

The upgrade from Rocky to Stein is quite special as it
needs to handle the OS upgrade. In the case of the Controllers
we create progressively a new cluster with the upgraded nodes.
Therefore we need to pass the already upgraded nodes everytime
we upgrade one (pass controller-0 and controller-1 when running
the upgrade of controller-1). However, this is not needed for
any other role and the current logic was implementing it for
all. The result was that we were running the upgrade of the
first compute twice (first compute-0 upgrade and second time when
running upgrade for compute-0 and compute-1).

This patch limits the HA dance only to the Controller role.

Change-Id: I864f3f2ca90416f567f94bff34a34bdbcea9237e
(cherry picked from commit 9ad387cb783409c7ccc0e08e25b005d43081d6ab)
'}]
commit_message:
Run upgrade for previous hosts only in Controller role.

The upgrade from Rocky to Stein is quite special as it
needs to handle the OS upgrade. In the case of the Controllers
we create progressively a new cluster with the upgraded nodes.
Therefore we need to pass the already upgraded nodes everytime
we upgrade one (pass controller-0 and controller-1 when running
the upgrade of controller-1). However, this is not needed for
any other role and the current logic was implementing it for
all. The result was that we were running the upgrade of the
first compute twice (first compute-0 upgrade and second time when
running upgrade for compute-0 and compute-1).

This patch limits the HA dance only to the Controller role.

Change-Id: I864f3f2ca90416f567f94bff34a34bdbcea9237e
(cherry picked from commit 9ad387cb783409c7ccc0e08e25b005d43081d6ab)

commit_message:
Avoid forced logout when 403 error encountered

Before this change when a 403 error was encountered, such as failure to
have the permission to perform an operation, the user would get logged
out from UI pages written in the AngularJS framework. For example, if an
admin user lacks the get_project permission and tries to access the
images page, project->compute->images, the 403 will forcibly log out
the user.

This change keeps the user logged in when a 403 error is encountered and
displays an error message. The change only affects AngularJS pages.

Change-Id: I10a6eeb96dd1418449e1d15b1a3869cd4de9cafa
Closes-bug: #1840844
(cherry picked from commit ab0e96df9506fb6f1783e0ee79b63934dabe0cbe)

commit_message:
config: make kolla work with oslo.config 7.0.0+

From oslo.config 7.0.0 release notes:

> Positional options are now required by default, to match argparse‚Äôs
> default behavior. To revert this behavior (and maintain optional
> positional arguments), you need to explicitly specify positional=True,
> required=False as part of the options definition.

So let's follow.

Change-Id: I77fdbcb905b1a7f2d535c3a37b2899118d1442c5

commit_message:
Move undercloud_os_upgrade.yaml to tasks/common.

In FFWD2 an upgrade of the Undercloud's operating system will
be also needed. So let's move the playbook into tasks/common
so we can leverage from the existing code when implementing
the undercloud upgrade in FFWD2.

Change-Id: Id9d50979e747ab5717a05b41fa594459089a150b
(cherry picked from commit 4a6ccae840f99f4e5367935ce536dc64b3f1e13b)

commit_message:
Update hacking version to 1.1.x

This commit updates hacking version in test-requirements
and fixes some related pep8 issues

Also ignores false positive bandit test
B105: hardcoded_password_string,
B106: hardcoded_password_funcarg
based on variable or argument names.
For more info refer [1][2]

[1] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b105_hardcoded_password_string.html
[2] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b106_hardcoded_password_funcarg.html

Change-Id: If779ebad11926594961577e0744093a8ba691610
Story: 2004930
Task: 29314
(cherry picked from commit 3404a6df722b8f85c425d15769a0e831891cdc2c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 10:32:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add 'interface' field to Workflow resource

* Workflow resource(returned by workflow-get APIs) has a new JSON field
 called 'interface', it contains the inputs and the outputs.

  -Both input and output are lists.
  -The output list contains the output param names.
  -The input list contains the inputs, if the input has a default value,
   the entry in the list will be a JSON object, with the name of the
   input and the default value, otherwise its the input param name.

   For example:
     {"input": [ "input_with_no_default_value",
   { "string_input": "some_string" },
   {"json_input": {
     "defaultKey": "defaultValue"
    }}],
     "output":["output1","output2"]}

Change-Id: Id9be6c1d9bbe4a4c965530364833e71f8b7cacc6
Implements: blueprint mistral-workflow-outputs-in-wf-apis
Signed-off-by: ali <ali.abdelal@nokia.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-01-09 10:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add 'interface' field to Workflow resource

  -The input list contains the inputs, if the input has a default value,
   the entry in the list will be a JSON object, with the name of the
   input and the default value, otherwise its the input param name.

   For example:
     {"input": [ "input_with_no_default_value",
   { "string_input": "some_string" },
   {"json_input": {
     "defaultKey": "defaultValue"
    }}],
     "output":["output1","output2"]}

Change-Id: Id9be6c1d9bbe4a4c965530364833e71f8b7cacc6
Implements: blueprint mistral-workflow-outputs-in-wf-apis
Signed-off-by: ali <ali.abdelal@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Add 'interface' field to Workflow resource

* Workflow resource(returned by workflow-get APIs) has a new JSON field
 called 'interface', it contains the inputs and the outputs.

  -Both input and output are lists.
  -The output list contains the output param names.
  -The input list contains the inputs, if the input has a default value,
   the entry in the list will be a JSON object, with the name of the
   input and the default value, otherwise its the input param name.

   For example:
     {"input": [ "input_with_no_default_value",
   { "string_input": "some_string" },
   {"json_input": {
     "defaultKey": "defaultValue"
    }}],
     "output":["output1","output2"]}

Change-Id: Id9be6c1d9bbe4a4c965530364833e71f8b7cacc6
Implements: blueprint mistral-workflow-outputs-in-wf-apis
Signed-off-by: ali <ali.abdelal@nokia.com>

Agree with Rabi's comment, use current config design to do the job is more ideal"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-13 13:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-09-17 10:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-09-18 05:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> compare to a situation when you e.g. asked for the trunk extension to be deployed....

Not sure I get the point. Why would heat tests test if neutron is deployed as expected or not?

Those should surely be taken care of by the neutron tempest tests (for trunk suppprt) or possibly by the ones that check the available extensions[1] or by deployment tool sanity check by running whatever tests.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/master/neutron_tempest_plugin/api/test_extensions.py'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2020-01-17 10:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Currently (in master) this whole test case it decorated with requires_resource_type, and thus relies on Heat service autodiscovering available Neutron extensions, which should be enough for the scope of Heat testing.

Can be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2020-01-17 11:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

not needed any more'}]

commit_message:
Skip tests when neutron extension trunk is absent

We need to skip tests if some feature doesn't exist on environment. These tests are failing now:
heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_create_update_neutron_trunk.UpdateTrunkTest.test_add_a_second_sub_port
heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_create_update_neutron_trunk.UpdateTrunkTest.test_add_first_sub_port
heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_create_update_neutron_trunk.UpdateTrunkTest.test_remove_last_sub_port_from_trunk
heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_create_update_neutron_trunk.UpdateTrunkTest.test_remove_sub_port_from_trunk
heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_create_update_neutron_trunk.UpdateTrunkTest.test_update_existing_sub_port_on_trunk
heat_tempest_plugin.tests.functional.test_create_update_neutron_trunk.UpdateTrunkTest.test_update_trunk_name_and_description

Change-Id: I8504db7c6f416959a1d6dd3ed0734c3e6b94a1f5

subject: Remove six usage from openstack_dashboard package
messages:
[{'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-09 14:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-09 14:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-10 08:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-10 08:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-10 10:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-10 10:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-11 13:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-11 13:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

What should we do for six in requirements.txt?
Many horizon plugins do not have six in requirements.txt and depends on six dependency in horizon. Thus we cannot drop six from requirements.txt right now. It means we cannot prevent from adding six import again without careful manual reviews but I don't think it is a good way. Theoretically all plugins who use six should have six in their requirements.txt explicitly."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-11 13:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This is my quick search result
http://paste.openstack.org/show/788272/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-01-11 15:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Change for zaqar-ui: https://review.opendev.org/702074'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-01-11 15:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://review.opendev.org/702076 and https://review.opendev.org/702075 are similar low-hanging fruit'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-01-11 15:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I pushed a few more - I used topic:remove-six'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-11 16:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks Andreas for cleaning up six usage in plugins!'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-01-11 16:50:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

You're welcome. Not that I left a few for others to join in the fun ;)"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-14 08:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-14 08:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Added +2 by a mistake:('}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:47:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(5 comments)

Since six.reraise is still used, I didn't remove it from requirements.txt.

Plugins should have six in their requirements file if they use it directly"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-16 14:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Since six.reraise is still used, I didn't remove it from requirements.txt.

Yeah, I noticed it after I commented last time.

> Plugins should have six in their requirements file if they use it directly

Totally agree. We sent a series of patches to drop six usage in plugins.
They can be merged independently."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-16 14:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-16 22:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-01-17 04:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-01-17 07:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 14:49:49.000000000', 'message': "Remove six usage from openstack_dashboard package

We don't support Python 2 anymore so we don't need this
compatibility library.

six.reraise usages are left as is until it'll be moved to some
base lib like oslo.utils to not re-implenent this method in
Horizon.

This patch also removes Python2-specific base test case methods
assertItemsEqual and assertNotRegexpMatches in flavor of new
Python 3 analogues.

commit_message:
Remove six usage from openstack_dashboard package

We don't support Python 2 anymore so we don't need this
compatibility library.

six.reraise usages are left as is until it'll be moved to some
base lib like oslo.utils to not re-implenent this method in
Horizon.

This patch also removes Python2-specific base test case methods
assertItemsEqual and assertNotRegexpMatches in flavor of new
Python 3 analogues.

Change-Id: I26a59176be9e9f213128e4945a58b9459334b626

commit_message:
Use Python 3 by default to run storlet applications

Use Python 3 to run storlet application when runtime version is not
specified.
Also fix py3 compatibility for some python storlet applications used
for functional tests.

Change-Id: Ic33bb339339e9ff446fd308663c692db834f2a81

commit_message:
nova-net: Kill it

Finish the job by removing all the now-unused modules. This also allows
us to - wait for it - kill mox at long last. It's a great day in the
parish.

Partial-Implements: blueprint remove-nova-network-ussuri
Partial-Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

Change-Id: Ia33ec2604b2fc2d3b6830b596cac669cc3ad6c96

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 08:38:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix horizon dependency

This commit moves horizon to requirements.txt.

horizon was added to uper-constraints in stable branches recently,
so installing from the tarball no longer works. upper-constraints
in stable branches picks up the right version of horizon, so there
is no need for the upper bound of the horizon version.

In addition, the link of the horizon tarball was not updated after
the stable branch was created. I don't know why it works for stable/train
but I believe this commit mitigates the situation as the upper-constraints
file in the requirements repo picks up the right version of horizon.

This commit is proposed directly as the similar change in the master
branch happened as part of Django 1.11 drop.

Change-Id: I9a310446743cfe6bca5480455b91a7cd74da8785
(cherry picked from commit 50475021dbe9a643043cdb39f57c01aede008dbb)

In addition, the link of the horizon tarball was not updated after

In addition, ironic-ui tox.ini specified install_command with the

properly.

commit_message:
Fix horizon dependency

This commit moves horizon to requirements.txt.

horizon was added to upper-constraints in stable branches recently,
so installing from the tarball no longer works. upper-constraints
in stable branches picks up the right version of horizon, so there
is no need for the upper bound of the horizon version.

In addition, the link of the horizon tarball was not updated after
the stable branch was created. I don't know why it works for stable/stein
but I believe this commit mitigates the situation as the upper-constraints
file in the requirements repo picks up the right version of horizon.

This commit is proposed directly as the similar change in the master
branch happened as part of Django 1.11 drop [1].

In addition, ironic-ui tox.ini specified install_command with the
upper-constraints.txt. The contraints file is now specified in "deps"
section to follow the convention used widely in the OpenStack community.
doc/requirements.txt is cleanup and the runtime and test requirements
are now added to "deps" of the "docs" env to generate the module index
properly.

stable/stein only:

commit_message:
Fix Django version in lower-constraints

horizon requires Django>=1.11 but lower-constraints.txt in ocatavia-dashboard
uses Django 1.8. As a result, the latest Django 3.0.1 which is not supported
in horizon yet is installed when installing horizon as sibling.
This leads to a failure in lower-constraints job like [1].

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/5ad97e34d5674d00af0713d57c02f616

Differences from the master branch
----------------------------------

requiremens.txt and lower-constraints.txt are updated to match
horizon's requirements in stable/stein.

Differences from the stable/train branch
----------------------------------------

sphinx in doc/requirements.txt is upated to match global-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I7f8db57600b39e4f230261e15d103b1d32968b38
(cherry picked from commit 86fb321f340fea70e5c0ef77e96197815ff0be92)
(cherry picked from commit 64221cd6ababd298018f9ebbdaae9410e1cec4a7)

commit_message:
Removed several gzip operations

As log storage takes care of compression is better to avoid performing
any gzip activity on *text* files that we want to access with the
browser.

Change-Id: I7dcd1cf569fea5e536926f7188af953c3301af0f

commit_message:
Remove old openstack/js-openstack-lib jobs

Legacy jobs are failing and block gating.
The other jobs are using legacy nodejs which is not
of interest either.
The plan is to move all job definitions into the
deliverable repository and port them to Zuul v3 format
and current nodejs (10, 12).

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/701854
Change-Id: I34cf69ee118010aa62a4bd3c601b6038a871bfea

The openstack javascript client library has been over in Infra
land for reasons I'm not sure any of us understand. Rados≈Çaw
Piliszek expressed interest in moving it forward. Since it has
support for sdk concepts such as clouds.yaml, and is a client
library, it seems that it would benefit from maintaining a home

commit_message:
Adopt js-openstack-lib into openstacksdk team

The openstack javascript client library has been over in Infra
land for reasons I'm not sure any of us understand. Rados≈Çaw
Piliszek expressed interest in moving it forward. Since it has
support for sdk concepts such as clouds.yaml, and is a client
library, it seems that it would benefit from maintaining a home
along with like-minded people inside of openstack.

Move the project from Infra to OpenStackSDK.

Change-Id: I794167a5a830398bd1f5c0055aa51ebaa80e5e6e

subject: Totalcount returned by pagination query is wrong and filters should before pagination query
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-17 07:02:28.000000000', 'message': "Totalcount returned by pagination query is wrong and filters should before pagination query

1.In this bugfix(https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688542/), totalcount returned
by pagination query is param 'limit'(should be total count of satisfy conditions).
2.Display_name,status,share_type_id,project_id and so on should filter out
before pagination query, rather than filter out in the result of pagination query.
3.Fuzzy matching of diaplay_name should use database.

Change-Id: Ia52c7aa40a4625efd5763ff6025726d0f0d39087
"}]
commit_message:
Totalcount returned by pagination query is wrong and filters should before pagination query

1.In this bugfix(https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688542/), totalcount returned
by pagination query is param 'limit'(should be total count of satisfy conditions).
2.Display_name,status,share_type_id,project_id and so on should filter out
before pagination query, rather than filter out in the result of pagination query.
3.Fuzzy matching of diaplay_name should use database.

Change-Id: Ia52c7aa40a4625efd5763ff6025726d0f0d39087

[{'created': '2020-01-16 11:57:29.000000000', 'message': 'HA: Honour all hiera override variables in mysql_bundle

During a major upgrade, upgrade tasks can rebuild a new pacemaker
cluster by adding nodes one at a time. This is implemented by
using two special hiera variables mysql_node_names_override and
mysql_short_node_names_override.

Make sure the mysql_bundle puppet module uses both variables
when such cluster rebuild is in progress.

Change-Id: I6a06269f55a38071c34d2a95109d213fe7e2452c
Closes-Bug: #1859961
Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-01-16 14:37:30.000000000', 'message': 'HA: Honour all hiera override variables in mysql_bundle

During a major upgrade, upgrade tasks can rebuild a new pacemaker
cluster by adding nodes one at a time. This is implemented by
using two special hiera variables mysql_node_names_override and
mysql_short_node_names_override.

Make sure the mysql_bundle puppet module uses both variables
when such cluster rebuild is in progress.

Change-Id: I6a06269f55a38071c34d2a95109d213fe7e2452c
Closes-Bug: #1859961
Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
HA: Honour all hiera override variables in mysql_bundle

During a major upgrade, upgrade tasks can rebuild a new pacemaker
cluster by adding nodes one at a time. This is implemented by
using two special hiera variables mysql_node_names_override and
mysql_short_node_names_override.

Make sure the mysql_bundle puppet module uses both variables
when such cluster rebuild is in progress.

Change-Id: I6a06269f55a38071c34d2a95109d213fe7e2452c
Closes-Bug: #1859961
Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove the Veritas Access Driver

The Veritas Access driver was marked
unsupported during the Train release.  Since
then, the 3rd Party CI hasn't been fixed and
there has been no sign of activity from the
vendor.  As a result the driver is being removed.

Change-Id: I9f11ce7a3600917f60130cfb79b5efd5dd580366
